title: Wrap SkPaint.setSubpixelText
body:
It'd be nice to wrap `SkPaint::setSubpixelText()` and/or `SkPaint::setLCDRenderText()` (I don't actually know the difference between these two). Without setting these flags to true to enable subpixel rendering, text rendered by SkiaSharp will appear slightly blurry.

Here's a side-by-side comparison of how text with greyscale antialiasing (the Skia default) compares with Windows ClearType subpixel rendering. The top text "No Subpixel" is rendered with SkiaSharp. The bottom text "Subpixel" is rendered with WPF, which by default uses ClearType (a subpixel rendering technique).

![subpixel](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/934815/17828270/efbe97d4-665a-11e6-882a-651fcc9804c8.png)

With my LCD monitor, the "Subpixel" text appears sharper than the "No Subpixel" text. You may have to right click and view the image in full size to see the difference, as Github scales down the preview to fit within the issue text, and the relevant detail may be lost in the raster scaling process.
